<<if $window is false>> You wake up. <<else>> Too awake, no sleep. <</if>> Hot weather outside, <<if $window is false>> no breeze through the closed [[window]]. <<else>> a cooling breeze humming through the window. <</if>> $gender.HeShe is lying beside you, still <<choice [[somewhere]]>> else.

<<if $fly is true and $window is true>> Clothes are [[scattered]] on the floor, deep colours dazzle, dousing the sunlight from outside like a waterfall. The [[mouth]] grabs you, chewing scraps of fabric over your body, swallowing its candy into its [[engine]].

<</if>>

You lost track of your steps. The darkness around you fills your body with butterflies, scribbling letters on your callow skin. They shine in white and blue as a cone of silver light observes your flesh, the machines' eyes penetrating your comfort zone.

The deep female voice is now near enough, vibrating through your limbs.

//[[Mother?|MA1]]//

[[Stay silent.|MA1]]

She laughs.

''Don't move, okay? I just need to check on that.''

//[[Sorry.|MD1.1]]

''You are not like the others, you know? You are my special $gender.youprinceprincess.''

''Don't move.'' There is a smile in her voice.

//[[It tickles!|MD1.2]]
[[Sorry. I won't move.|MD1.6]]//

passages.name: MB1
passages.text:
The constant stomping widens the darkness around you. Your eyelids are glued together, or sewed up. You can't open them.

[[You grasp at your eyes.|MB1.1]]

[[You scream.|MB1.2]]

[[You try to get on your knees.|MB1.3]]

links.text: You try to get on your knees.

passages.name: MB1.1
passages.text:
Hard, closed flesh. You don't feel any punctures or crumbly remains of anything, just plain cold skin. As if your eyes disappeared.

The stamping comes closer.

[[You surrender.|MB1.9]]
//[[Please help me, someone?|MB1.2]]//
[[You scream.|MB1.2]]
[[You try to tear open your eye.|MB1.7]]

links.text: You try to tear open your eye.

passages.name: MB1.2
passages.text:
No answer. Your body gets heavier with every movement, the strength slowly transpiring through your skin.

[[You try to get on your knees.|MB1.3]]

[[You scream.|MB1.4]]

[[You surrender.|MB1.9]]

<<set $fear +=1>>

links.text: You try to get on your knees.

passages.name: MB1.3
passages.text:
Your muscles burn. When you try to support yourself on the floor, you feel the sweat smearing with your movements, nearly slipping. A dank steam closes around you, while the deep

<<timedinsert 6s>>DUMP.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 7s>>DUMP.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 8s>>DUMP.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 9s>>comes closer. And louder. Echoing in the darkness.

[[You surrender.|MB1.9]]

[[You fight.|MB1.6]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: MB1.4
passages.text:
Still no answer. You notice the sound of the stamping coming closer, reverberating inside your breast. A slimy layer of moisture starts to cover your skin, smearing itself over your legs and into your clothes. Breathing gets hot. Steam gathers in your lungs, forcing you to cough, heart beating pain swallowing your mouth and eyes. Boiling. Hot. Hot. Hot. Hot. Hot. Too hot. Smoking, steaming, cooking your insides, the stamping right over you @@.upside-down;louder than your ears can crash down into silence.@@

passages.text:
You notice the sound of the stamping coming closer, reverberating inside your breast. A slimy layer of moisture starts to cover your skin, smearing itself over your legs and into your clothes. Breathing gets hot. Steam gathers in your lungs, forcing you to cough, heart beating pain swallowing your mouth and eyes. Boiling. Hot. Hot. Hot. Hot. Hot. Too hot. Smoking, steaming, cooking your insides, the stamping right over you @@.upside-down;louder than your ears can crash down into silence.@@

Your legs tremble when you stand up, heart pounding in sync with the stomps. It gets louder very fast. You feel for some wall or a grip, but there seems to be nothing around you.

[[Flee from the stomps.|MB1.8]]

passages.name: MB1.7
passages.text:
You grasp and pinch the warming outside of your right eye, pulling it slowly away. You loose it. And touch it again, a slightly deformed bulge und pulling, pulling until it breaks open, warm juice flooding your skin: a blinking white ball swimming in black wine.
[[hurts.|MB1.5]]

passages.name: MB1.8
passages.text:
You start running away from the sounds, blindly stretching your arms forward. The temperature rises, with boiling steam surrounding your body and invading your nostrils. You cough. It bites the skin inside your nose, a sore breath, but you keep running, running, running

passages.text: When you become conscious again, time is still the <<choice [[same.|A new world]]>><<if visited ("A new world") is 2>> You sit in front of Kim in your little Kitchen, the half eaten sausages on your plate. Kim eats, a distracted glance at the newspaper alongside his glass of red wine. $gender.HeShe is about 50 years old, judging by $gender.hisher looks. It is the first time you notice something like [[that.|A new world]]<</if>><<if visited ("A new world") is 3>> The world seems different, still. Like somehow you reached the surface for the first time, only now realising you were drowning. Your eyes burn and tickle as if you just slipped out of your mothers [[womb.|A new world]]<</if>><<if visited ("A new world") is 4>> It is a funny thing to be that aware of your surroundings. You see the coffee machine and the microwave on the kitchen worktop, you see oil, vinegar, salt and pepper. A half empty wine bottle, the name of the company written on it, two tomatoes and a slightly crinkled oven glove, [[darkgreen.|A new world]]<</if>><<if visited ("A new world") is 5>> But hanging above all is a most fascinating [[thing.|Picture]]<</if>>

You can feel the music of the colours vibrating in your eyeballs. It is very calming. Your heartrate slows down, but then you remember you probably don't have a heart <<choice [[at all.|Picture2]]>><<if visited ("Picture2") is 2>> Would it be possible to feel love without a heart? Or to feel anything without really [[feeling it?|Picture2]]<</if>>

<<if visited ("Picture2") is 3>>The really funny thing is, you think-
that suddenly, after all what happened, your love and your anxiety and your anger and your will to be obedient, all these emotions feel real for the first time.

You can think freely. You can feel freely.
It makes your chest [[hurt.|Picture2]]<</if>>

passages.name: OB6
passages.text:
@@.blur; Your freedom tasted like a candy coon. Savouring every last bit, a life like a sudden bang. What is this last thought you should think now?
<<timedinsert 5s>>
It all comes back to [[control.|OB7.1]]
It all comes back to [[love.|OB7.2]]
It all comes back to [[nature.|OB7.3]]
It all comes back to [[death.|OB7.4]]
<<endtimedinsert>>@@

passages.name: OB7
passages.text:
@@.blur;And now your body breaks slowly. There is no point in deluding yourself.

<<timedinsert 7s>>A click.
You feel something moving. The draining eyes in your head scroll squeaking down, looking at your right arm.

A mid-size square of skin opened up from your body, maybe 5 x 3 inches, revealing the view on some kind of an electric console. Your eyes catch a logo, written in small letters - 

''Moonland Corp. Model: 'i:v
Prototype''

And underneath the printing are several little [[buttons|OB8]], each a different colour.

<<endtimedinsert>>@@

passages.name: OB8
passages.text: @@.blurrier;A [[blue|BlueButton]] button for ''Sleep''. A [[darkgreen|DarkgreenButton]] button for ''Memory''. A [[violet|VioletButton]] button for ''Shutdown''. A [[yellow|YellowButton]] button for ''Emergency''. A [[black|BlackButton]] button for ''Mother''.@@ <><><>

passages.name: OB1.2Copy
passages.text:
When you stand up, Kim raises $gender.hisher head, but not aware at all.

<<timedinsert 3s>>''You want to go to bed yet?''<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 5s>>Yes.

You seemed to know the house by heart, but then you feel very different now. There is clarity at the moment, but before the incident things were blurry. You can't be sure which way to go.

There are two doors leading from the kitchen in different directions.

You go right through the wooden door.|OB2

You go left through the white door with the huge window.|OB2





<<set $vision to "your own bloodshot eyes">>

passages.name: OB2.2
passages.text: Doppelklick auf diesen Absatz zum Bearbeiten.

passages.name: OB2.1
passages.text:
You went through the wooden door, heart hammering hard against your chest. Now you stand in a small corridor. Thick brown carpets crawl over the floor, leading to two other wooden doors on the right side.

<<timedinsert 10s>>It is dark enough to see nearly nothing. Shadowy figures of cabinets and paintings watch you from afar. Only at the end of the corridor a glimpse of light leads to probably another exit. 
It could lie of course. Never trust the light.

You go through the first wooden door on the right side.

You go through the second wooden door.

You trust the light.

You search for another door in the dark.

passages.text:
You decided to deny yourself the only thing life is defined by.
<<timedinsert 5s>>For the being who desired a higher form of consciousness, the only way to escape death is never awakening again.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 10s>>When life is but a dream, would you be able to dream?<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedgoto "End1" 20s>>

passages.name: OBE1.8.2
passages.text:
@@color:red;The heat burns holes into your lateral hypothalamus, your prefrontal cortex and your ventral tegmental area.@@

[[Thank you.|OB1.8.2]]

passages.name: OBE1.6.2
passages.text:
@@color:red;Some broken paths in your fibre glass nervous tissue submerge in coolant, a sparkling web of lost information. 

It lets your body vibrate with a dazed neural system.@@

[[Thank you.|OB1.6.2]]

passages.text: @@.blur;You swim in the warmth of $gender.hisher body right behind you. $gender.HeShe bends over your right shoulder, $gender.hisher breath blowing over your skin. A grip clasps around your wrist, lifting your right arm upwards. [[Failure: scripting.op.003 not found.|OB5]]@@ <>

passages.text:
@@color:red; Tiny metal sticks constructed to stabilize your brain complex slip out of place and slowly squeeze your cerebellum. Temporary spasms occur.@@

[[Thank you.|OB1.8]]

passages.name: OBE1.4.3
passages.text:
@@color:red; Liquid floats through your brain, cocooning your silicone amygdalla brain area. A slight strain wanders to the surface of your skull, making it ache.@@

[[Thank you.|OB1.4.3]]

passages.name: OBE1.9
passages.text:
@@color:red; 78°C, rising. Cerebral plasticine fuses into new shapes. The hypothalamus-infundibulum replica disappears into the sea of coolant, giving birth to a fierce hunger.

A WARNING MESSAGE appears right in front of you.@@

[[Thank you.|OB1.9]]

passages.name: OB1.9
passages.text: @@color:red;WARNING: Overheating@@ <>$gender.HeShe touches your cheek, whispering words to calm you down.<><> Even when you are as calm as a dead flower.<> <>The feeling of hunger and devotion is overwhelming. Your eyes burn with coolant while you taste $gender.hisher flesh, chewing $gender.hisher sun tanned hand. White noise sounds, stars. Warm. A skin with flesh and blood, you bathe in love.<> <>[[Failure: scripting.op.003 not found.|OBE1.10]]<>

passages.name: OBE1.10
passages.text:
@@color:red;Something new emerges from the coolant soup. The abstract sculpture made of android brain matter looks like a poppy.@@

[[Thank you.|OB1.10]]

passages.name: OB1.10
passages.text: @@color:red;WARNING: Overheating@@ <>Kims odor has a power of persuasion that fills you up like the screams $gender.heshe makes, shrill and exquisite. They mark your devotion, enhancing the hunger of your new-made brain.<> <>Only when your stomach stretches, a slow tingle of content vibrates through your limbs.<> <>[[Failure: scripting.op.003 not found.|OBE1.11]]<>

passages.text:
@@color:red; A waterfall of coolant and blood.@@

[[Thank you.|OB5]]

passages.name: KeyMemorySpecialEnding
passages.text:
<<timedinsert 3s>>You decided to embrace forgottenness in avoidance of chaos.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 10s>>Even if chaos could be the only sure ingredient of the conscious mind.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 15s>>When the living can dream of death, why can't the unliving dream of life?<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedgoto "EndLost" 25s>>

passages.name: KeyMemory5
passages.text:
@@.blurrier;<<timedinsert 3s>>@@color:black; It's a white cube with one big black hole in the middle, smoothly drifting in front of you. When it stops a shiver runs down your spine and you want to close your eyes in admiration. The drum fades into the background of your young mind.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 13s>>@@color:black; When you open again, several long silverbeams erupt lazily from the machine, like a breathing volcano. They slide gently through the liquid, touching your body. Illuminating.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 23s>>[[Watch.|KeyMemory6]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: KeyMemory4.3
passages.text:
@@.blurrier;<<timedinsert 3s>>@@color:black; You descend into the red, devouring the love and security it excretes.<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 10s>>@@color:black; You could do that like forever.<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 20s>><<if $slime is false>>[[Taste the slime again.|KeyMemory4.1]]<</if>>
[[Look down at yourself.|KeyMemory4.2]]<<endtimedinsert>>

<<set $float to true>>

passages.name: KeyMemory6
passages.text:
@@.blurrier;<<timedinsert 3s>>@@color:black; When the beams reach your structure, they burn. Your construct starts trembling and white flakes of flesh appear in the light, slowly covering your bones in human armor.@@<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 13s>>@@color:black;  Tendons, muscles, vessels, flesh and liquid in a fibre glass cobweb obscuring the being you were.@@<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedinsert 20s>>@@color:black;[[Keep admiring the machine.|KeyMemory8]]<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: KeyMemory7
passages.text: @@.blurrier;<<timedinsert 3s>>@@color:black; A white bar lifts from afar, glaring through the thick red slime around you.@@<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 13s>>@@color:black; You turn you arm, and the bar turns until a white ceramic gripper appears, with five shiny fingers of equal length.@@<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 23s>>@@color:black; It resembles the [[machine|KeyMemoryMachine]].@@<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: KeyMemory8
passages.text: @@.blurrier;<<timedinsert 3s>>@@color:black; The burn intensifies into a deep embrace, squeezing your lungs and throat.@@<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 13s>>@@color:black; When the silver beams touch your chest, and you look at your costal arch moving over your breathing system.@@<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 20s>>@@color:black; Everything becomes [[indistinct|KeyMemory8.1]].@@<<endtimedinsert>>

passages.name: ShutdownEND
passages.text:
You wanted to end your existence consciously rather than trying to avoid the unavoidable.
<<timedinsert 5s>>For the being who is able to decide to die, a humanoid consciousness should be granted.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 15s>>Was it worth it?<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedgoto "End1" 20s>>

passages.name: THEEND
passages.text:
You did not decide when decision was granted.<<timedinsert 5s>>
For the soul who waited too long, life passed by and muffled what was left in nothingness.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 10s>>You feel it flooding around you, covering your mouth, your eyes, your ears, your nose.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 15s>> Your limbs, your chest, your head.<<endtimedinsert>>
<<timedinsert 20s>> Then ...<<endtimedinsert>>

<<timedgoto "End1" 25s>>

The white snake follows the light, its figure crawling behind you.@@<<endtimedinsert>><<timedinsert 27s>>@@color:black; You feel it biting your neck, disappearing inside your flesh. passages.name: hand
passages.text:
White flesh on metallic bones. You turn your wrist and watch the red slime explode from the cracks in your skin. The head of your lover transforms into the machine and a languid humming crawls through the room, coming closer and closer until the big black stomach of the machine is all you can [[see|black3]]
